intro: Mitrasacme laevis, commonly known as the smooth mitrasacme, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are smooth and often oval in shape. Its flowers are typically small and white or pale pink, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Mitrasacme laevis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
